Class MazeGenerator

extends java.lang.Object
    A class to generate mazes!
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    danilafe

      • generateRecursiveBacktrackerMaze

        public static byte[][] generateRecursiveBacktrackerMaze(int width,
                                                        int height,
                                                        byte wallid,
                                                        byte emptyid,
                                                        byte visitedid,
                                                        java.lang.Byte[] safeTiles)
        Generates a new maze using the Recursive Backtracker algorithm.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the generated maze, in "corridors" - walls don't count as part of the width.
        height - the height of the generated maze, in "corridors" - walls don't count as part of the width.
        Returns:
        the generated array of bytes. 0 means wall, 1 means unvisited and 2 means empty.

      • generateRecursiveBacktrackerMaze

        public static void generateRecursiveBacktrackerMaze(byte[][] mazeArray,
                                                    byte wallid,
                                                    byte emptyid,
                                                    byte visitedid,
                                                    java.lang.Byte[] safeTiles)
        Fills the given array with maze pathways. Existing rooms do not get connected on purpose.
        Parameters:
        mazeArray - the array to use for generating a maze. Has to be a "walled" array, represented as follows:
        # # # # #
        # # #
        # # # # #
        # # #
        # # # # #

      • backtrack

        private static boolean backtrack(byte[][] array,
                                 int pos_x,
                                 int pos_y,
                                 int pos_prevx,
                                 int pos_prevy,
                                 int mazeWidth,
                                 int mazeHeight,
                                 int currentSize,
                                 int maxSize,
                                 int[] lastCell,
                                 byte useAsUnvisited,
                                 byte useAsCorridor,
                                 java.lang.Byte[] safeTiles)
        Recursive function responsible for generating a maze using the Recursive Backtracker algorithm.
        Parameters:
        array - the array being modified recursively. Should be a "walled" array, represented as follows:
        # # # # #
        # # #
        # # # # #
        # # #
        # # # # #
        pos_x - the x-coordinate of the cell that's being processed
        pos_y - the y-coordinate of the cell that's being processed
        pos_prevx - the x-coordinate of the cell that moved to this one
        pos_prevy - the y-coordinate of the cell that moved to this one
        mazeWidth - the width of the maze being generated.
        mazeHeight - the height of the maze being generated.

      • printMazeArray

        public static void printMazeArray(byte[][] maze)
        Prints a maze array, replacing byte values with their respective characters.
        Parameters:
        maze - the maze array to print.

      • writeToMazeRarray

        private static void writeToMazeRarray(byte[][] maze,
                                      int w,
                                      int h,
                                      byte val)
        Writes a value to a given "corridor position" (which doesn't include walls)
        Parameters:
        maze - the array to write to
        w - the x-coordinate or the w-position of where to write
        h - the y-coordinate or the h-position of where to write
        val - the value to write

      • writeBetween

        private static void writeBetween(byte[][] maze,
                                 int w1,
                                 int h1,
                                 int w2,
                                 int h2,
                                 byte val)
        Writes a value to the wall between the given cells.
        Parameters:
        maze - the array to write to
        w1 - the x-coordinate or the w-position of the first cell
        h1 - the y-coordinate or the h-position of the first cell
        w2 - the x-coordinate or the w-position of the second cell
        h2 - the y-coordinate or the h-position of the second cell
        val - the value to write

        h - the y-coordinate or the h-position of where to read

      • isSurrounded

        private static boolean isSurrounded(byte[][] maze,
                                    int w,
                                    int h,
                                    java.lang.Byte[] tiletypes)
        Checks if all corridor cells (not walls!) around this one (not diagonally) are also "visited"
        Parameters:
        maze - the maze to read from
        w - the x-coordinate or the w-position of the potentially surrounded cell
        h - the y-coordinate or the h-position of the potentially surround cell
        tiletypes - the types of tiles to avoid overwriting
        Returns:

      • fillArea

        private static void fillArea(byte[][] maze,
                             int w1,
                             int h1,
                             int w2,
                             int h2,
                             byte value)
        Fills the area between the given two corridor points (not array indexes!) with the given value, walls included
        Parameters:
        maze - the array to process
        w1 - the x-coordinate or the w-position of the first cell
        h1 - the y-coordinate or the h-position of the first cell
        w2 - the x-coordinate or the w-position of the second cell
        h2 - the y-coordinate or the h-position of the second cell
        val - the value to write

      • floodFill

        private static boolean floodFill(byte[][] array,
                                 int x,
                                 int y,
                                 byte toReplace,
                                 byte value,
                                 int current,
                                 int maxStack,
                                 int[] lastCell)
        Flood fills the given array, replacing one value with another.
        Parameters:
        array - the array to flood fill
        x - the starting x-coordinate of the flood fill
        y - the starting y-coordinate of the flood fill
        toReplace - the value to be replaced
        value - the value to replace with
        current - the current stack height, counting from the first iteration of this function
        the - max stack height
        lastCell - the cell to return to once the function stops due to stack overflow

      • fillWithRooms

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Rectangle> fillWithRooms(byte[][] array,
                                                                    int iterations,
                                                                    int maxDim,
                                                                    boolean allowIntersection,
                                                                    byte roomid,
                                                                    java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Rectangle> existingRects)
        Replaces parts of the maze with room tiles. (room tile id = 3)
        Parameters:
        array - the array to perform the operation on.
        iterations - how many times to try place a room
        maxDim - the maximum possible width / height of a room.
        allowIntersection - whether to allow rooms to intersect
        roomid - the tile ID to place as the room
        existingRects - rectangles preresenting other rooms already placed

      • fillWithRooms

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Rectangle> fillWithRooms(byte[][] array,
                                                                    int iterations,
                                                                    int maxDim,
                                                                    boolean allowIntersection,
                                                                    byte roomid)

      • isConnector

        private static boolean isConnector(byte[][] array,
                                   int x,
                                   int y,
                                   byte valA,
                                   byte valB)
        Checks if the cell connects other cells of valueA and valueB
        Parameters:
        array - the array to perform the operation on
        x - the x-coordinate of the cell to check
        y - the y-coordinate of the cell to check
        valA - the first value the cell has to touch
        valB - the second value the cell has to touch
        Returns:
        whether the cell touches other cells of both types

      • connectPassages

        public static void connectPassages(byte[][] array)
        Finds areas with room tiles, and if they are adjacent to empty corridors, connects them and also marks them as empty space.
        Parameters:
        array - the array to perform the operation on.

                                 byte valB)
        Generic method to connect two different tile IDS
        Parameters:

        valA - the first value to connect
        valB - the second value to connect

      • generateMazeImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage generateMazeImage(byte[][] mazeArray,
                                                             int cellWidth,
                                                             int cellHeight,
                                                             java.awt.Color wallColor,
                                                             java.awt.Color emptyColor)
        Creates a buffered image with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        mazeArray - the array to convert to an image
        cellWidth - the width of the cells drawn on the image
        cellHeight - the height of the cells drawn on the image
        wallColor - the color of the walls to draw to the buffered image
        emptyColor - the color of the floor to draw to the buffered image
        Returns:
        the produced buffered image

        Returns:
